awd_titl_txt: U.S. Panel on Wind and Seismic Effects
awd_abstract_narration: 9510235  Raufaste  This  award provides continuing support for the U.S.\Japan  Panel  on  Wind  and Seismic Effects which was established  in  1968  to  further  collaborative efforts between the  two  countries.   The  panel   develops   knowledge   and  technologies   that   advance  engineering  design  and construction practices.   The  panel  is  comprised  of  18 Federal agencies who participate  in  ten  task  committees.   The  task  committees focus  on  specific  national  issues,  e.g.,  passive and active control  systems;  repair  and  retrofit  of structures; and wind and earthquake engineering  for  offshore structures.  Annual meetings alternate between Japan and  the U.S.  ***
org_div_long_name: Division of Civil, Mechanical, and Manufacturing Innovation
